questions.question_text: A technician needs to perform after-hours service starting at 10:00 p.m. The technician is currently 20 minutes late. The customer will also be late. Which of the following should the technician do considering proper communication techniques and professionalism?

choices.C: Contact the customer if the technician is arriving late.
choices.A: Do not notify the customer if arriving before the customer.
choices.D: Disclose the experience via social media
choices.B: Dismiss the customer and proceed with the after-hours work.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C Communication with the customer is crucial to prevent frustration on both sides about expectations.

C. Contact the customer if the technician is arriving late.

It's essential for the technician to communicate effectively with the customer, especially if there are delays. By contacting the customer and informing them of the delay, the technician demonstrates professionalism and respect for the customer's time. This allows the customer to adjust their schedule accordingly and helps maintain a positive relationship.

questions.question_text: A client wants a technician to set up a proxy server in a branch office to manage internet access. This involves configuring the workstations to use the new proxy server. Which of the following Internet Options tabs in Control Panel would be most appropriate for the technician to use to configure the settings?

discussion.content:
D. Connections
The Connections tab in Internet Options is where you can configure proxy server settings. This tab allows you to specify the address of the proxy server and the port number to be used for internet traffic. By configuring this setting on the workstations, all internet traffic will be routed through the proxy server, allowing for centralized management and control of internet access.

Selected Answer: D
D is correct.
https://www.freecram.net/question/CompTIA.220-1102.v2024-03-02.q224/a-client-wants-a-technician-to-set-up-a-proxy-server-in-a-branch-office-to-manage-internet-access-this

questions.question_text: A customer installed a new web browser from an unsolicited USB drive that the customer received in the mail. The browser is not working as expected, and internet searches are redirected to another site. Which of the following should the user do next after uninstalling the browser?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
After uninstalling the untrusted browser, itâ€™s important to have a secure and trusted browser for safe internet browsing.

Selected Answer: D
Seems like it should be D. Use a trusted browser. 2nd choice is C. ChatGPT says B, but that's no good since you'll be deleting the bad browser.

comments.content: this question is od none of this awnsers seems correct. i would serch for malware first

Answer D: doesn't say to "Use" a trusted browser, it says to install one. What were they using before they installed the new one, from the USB? They must have a trusted browser already installed. Broswer options in windows, not the browser itself, would allow you to reset the default browser.

choices.A: Delete the browser cookies and history.
choices.C: Change the browser default search engine.

questions.question_text: A company is creating an access control system that uses something you have and something you are. Which of the following will be required for user authentication? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CD
Password Manager - something you know a password
Encryption Keys - Once again, something you know.
Biometric Scanner - Something you are
Smartcard Reader - Something you have
Host based IDS - IDS isn't even anything to do with this
Pin Code - Something you know.

so CD is the obvious only answer.

Selected Answer: BC
A smartcard is not the same as a reader. I chose BC.
The answer is CD.

Selected Answer: CF
Pin Code= Something you know
Biometric Scanner=Something you are
Is there any reason why this is CD and Not like CF since both of these meet the standards of being MFA? With Biometric is something you are and Pin being something you know.

comments.content: A PIN code is something you know. The question ask for something you have and something you are.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CD
Have: card
Are: eyes, fingers, face, voice

questions.question_text: An administrator configured security features on company-owned mobile devices to help protect against data loss. Which of the following is the best way to protect data on a misplaced device?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Remote wipe because CompTIA

Selected Answer: A
Remote wipe is the BEST solution and honestly, you should have both, the data should be encrypted if its that valuable and then wiped when lost.

Selected Answer: A
Comptia really wants you to yeet that data no matter what, forget the user!

I would go with A people...even if the device has encryption it can still be cracked...wiping the data from the device is your safest bet...and misplace or lost device is no different from a device that is stolen... ;)

Selected Answer: A
A makes the most sense because encryption does protect the information. However, it would be better for whoever has stolen the device to not have any access to the information.

Selected Answer: B
In the context of a misplaced device, B. Device encryption would indeed be a very effective way to protect data.

Selected Answer: B
yutface is right. they are not talking about stolen device

comments.content: Sorry, but it's not the BEST. Having no access to any data is better than having access to some encrypted one, it's just a fact. If they managed to login to the phone, which is possible, your encryption will mean nothing.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Remote wipe is a great option for stolen devices, but it's not ideal for a misplaced device as it could permanently erase valuable data even if the device is recovered.

I'd go with encryption. Even if someone gains physical access to the device, they can't access the info without the decryption key.
